intro: Silene vulgaris subsp. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial species that grows up to 30–60 cm tall, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink or purple flowers with five petals, typically blooming in summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats, and its seeds are dispersed by wind. The species is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
